p.s: Description of Roseibacillus ishigakijimensis sp. nov.
Roseibacillus ishigakijimensis (i.shi.ga.ki.ji.men′sis. N.L. masc. adj. ishigakijimensis pertaining to Ishigakijima, an island in Okinawa, from where the type strain was isolated).
Main characteristics are the same as those given for the genus.
In addition, cells are 0.7–0.8 μm wide and 1.0–1.5 μm long.
Neither cellular gliding movement nor swarming growth is observed.
Colonies grown on 1/5-strength MA are circular, convex and pale pink in colour.
The temperature range for growth is 20–37 °C, with optimal growth at 30–37 °C.
No growth occurs at either 4 or 45 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6.5–9.0.
NaCl is required for growth and can be tolerated up to 6 % (w/v).

Alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4) and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase tests are positive, but leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C4), cystine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase tests are negative.
Tween 80, l-arabinose, d-glucose, lactulose, maltose and dl-lactic acid are oxidized.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains muramic acid and meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 61.4 mol%.
The type strain is MN1-741T (=MBIC08315T =KCTC 12986T), which was isolated from seawater by using an in situ cultivation technique.
